Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/List/tail
Synopsis Take the last element(s) from a list.
Function
  1. list[&T] tail(list[&T] lst) throws EmptyList
  2. list[&T] tail(list[&T] lst, int len) throws IndexOutOfBounds(int index)
Description
  1. Return a list consisting of all but the first element of lst.
  2. Return a list consisting of the last n elements of lst.
Examples All but first element: 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>tail([10,20,30]);
list[int]: [20,30]
rascal>tail([]);
Uncaught Rascal Exception: prompt:///:1,0: EmptyList()
    somewhere in: public org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IValue org.rascalmpl.library.List.tail(org.eclipse.imp.pdb.»
facts.IList)
    somewhere in: $shell$
Last n elements: 
rascal>tail([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60], 3);
list[int]: [40,50,60]
rascal>tail([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60], 10);
Uncaught Rascal Exception: prompt:///:1,0: IndexOutOfBounds(4)
    somewhere in: public org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IValue org.rascalmpl.library.List.tail(org.eclipse.imp.pdb.»
facts.IList,org.eclipse.imp.pdb.facts.IInteger)
    somewhere in: $shell$
